dataLink.name: Global Gridded Land Use Forcing Datasets

availability.description: Global Gridded Land Use Forcing Data
availability.name: Global Gridded Land Use Forcing Datasets

description: 1950s (10 year) mean global gridded land-use forcing data.  This new generation of “land use harmonization” (LUH2) builds upon past work from CMIP5, and includes updated inputs, higher spatial resolution, more detailed land-use transitions, and the addition of important agricultural management layers.
name: 1950s Land Use
rationale: Land cover and land use change may have an impact on the surface albedo, evapotranspiration, sources and sinks of greenhouse gases, or other properties of the climate system and may thus give rise to radiative forcing and/or other impacts on climate, locally or globally.
